question: What is a closure in JavaScript and how does it enable data encapsulation?
answer: A closure is when a function remembers and accesses variables from its outer lexical scope, even after the outer function has finished executing.
diagram:
graph TD
    A[Outer Function Called] --> B[Outer Variables Created]
    B --> C[Inner Function Defined]
    C --> D[Inner Function Returned]
    D --> E[Outer Function Completes]
    E --> F[Inner Function Still Has Access]
    F --> G[Closure Maintains Reference]
    G --> H[Private Data Encapsulation]
